author: Chris Davie
title: Rio Ferdinand says Chelsea have no chance of being caught in the Premier League
text:
Rio Ferdinand says no team will overtake Chelsea this season. (Getty Images) Rio Ferdinand believes there is no team in the Premier League’s top six that is consistent enough to catch Chelsea in the title race.
Antonio Conte’s side left it late to register a 2-1 victory over Stoke City on Saturday which extends their lead at the top of the table to 13 points.
The Chelsea boss admits he is still wary of his side being caught and is adamant that 21 points are still needed to win the title, but Ferdinand believes his former rivals have the league wrapped up.
‘These boys are running away with it,’ the former Manchester United defender told BT Sport.
Ferdinand has praised Conte for his impact at Chelsea. (BPI) More: Football When will Chelsea win the title as Conte eyes 21 points?

‘There’s no one consistent enough to stay with them in the league.
‘They’ve found a way of playing, a formula, an understanding of the manager’s ideas.
‘I think he [Conte] has to take huge credit, the season before… terrible season, so far off the pace.
‘He’s come in and, based on repetition, built an understanding of how he wants the team to play and the players are really putting it in, he’s run away with the league this year.’
